oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Explanatory remarks concerning copies of Bushmen Paintings and Etchings, collected by Mr. H.C. Schunke and deposited in the Grey Library. Partly in Bushman by and partly in English after |han=kass'o (L VIII.-1. 6054-6057, 6061-6073). A list of remarks by |han=kass'o alongside the numbers (I-XXIV) of a collection of copies of paintings found in the Grey Library. These paintings are mostly of animals and rainmakers and their work with the rain. 1) p.6067v & 6068v: |han=kass'o's note on 'another !khoa ka ||kerri-ssi !kau'; a note on the !khoa ka ||kerri-ssi !kau that |han=kass'o saw in a painting copied by a 'Kafir' artist, 2) p.6071v: on a man called Oud Koos, or !ka !kain-i, 3) See also An account of the rain's things or '!khoa ka ||kerri-ssi !kau', 4) This story is found in Book VIII-1.
